title: CIA Warned Europe of Potential Attacks on Nord Stream Pipelines
description: The warning was not specific, the officials said, and they declined to say whether Russia was identified as a possible attacker.

title: Nord Stream Pipeline Breaks Look Deliberate, Europeans Say
description: The leaks in the Nord Stream under the Baltic Sea heightened fears of shortages because of the clash with Russia, and showed how vital infrastructure could be at risk.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Russia Suspected of Pipeline Sabotage
description: Plus a typhoon heads toward Vietnam and a thwarted Chinese attempt to influence U.S. elections.

title: Putin Is Expected to Annex Parts of Ukraine After Referendums End
description: The staged votes earned broad international condemnation, and world leaders vowed not to recognize the announced results.

title: Truss Takes a Bold Economic Gamble. Will It Sink Her Government?
description: Three weeks into her term, Prime Minister Liz Truss’s financial plans have thrown the markets and Britain’s currency into chaos and put her future in peril.

title: Prince Mohammed bin Salman Named Saudi Prime Minister
description: The crown prince, who has already been the kingdom’s de facto ruler for several years, previously served as deputy prime minister under King Salman, as well as defense minister.

title: The number of Russian citizens entering the E.U. has jumped 30 percent since Putin’s call for more troops.
For a Deaf Family in Ukraine, War Is a Bewildering Terror
description: People with disabilities in the country are often isolated and poor, and for those like Antonina Andriyenko and her daughter, Tanya, the fear and confusion of trying to stay safe is a constant struggle.

title: Keir Starmer Accuses Liz Truss of Losing Control of Britain’s Economy
description: Under the governing Conservatives, the markets are down and the pound is under pressure. On Thursday, Keir Starmer, the Labour leader, staked his claim as the guardian of sound fiscal policy.

title: Opposition Leader Tries to Seize the Moment as Britain’s Financial Woes Mount
description: Under the governing Conservatives, the markets are down and the pound is under pressure. On Thursday, Kir Starmer, the Labour leader, staked his claim as the guardian of sound fiscal policy.

title: An Israel-Lebanon Border Deal Could Increase Natural Gas Supplies
description: Offshore gas fields in the Mediterranean could become one of several new energy sources for European countries as they seek independence from Russia.

title: Putin Expected to Annex Parts of Ukraine After Referendums End
description: The Kremlin-led polls have drawn broad international condemnation.

title: Typhoon Noru Aims for Vietnam After Hitting the Philippines
description: More than 800,000 people were evacuated in central Vietnam ahead of the storm’s expected landfall on Wednesday.

title: Paul Gicheru, Kenya Lawyer on Trial at I.C.C., Is Found Dead
description: Paul Gicheru was accused of tampering with witnesses in favor of President William Ruto, whose trial at The Hague collapsed in 2016. The cause of death is not yet known.

title: Democracy Under Siege From Autocrats, Social Media and Its Own Failures
description: Authoritarianism is on the rise, even in Europe, and the “new world disorder” is messier than a simple fight between democracies and autocracies.

title: Turkish Author Ece Temelkuran Sees a Contested U.S. Election Through the Lens of an Attempted Coup
description: Ece Temelkuran, a Turkish author, sees parallels between Donald Trump’s claims of election theft and the 2016 attempt to depose Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: Mete Coban Is Working to Engage Younger Voters in British Politics
description: Mete Coban got into politics in his teens. Now, he’s working to encourage a similar drive in young voters.

title: Liberal Politics Needs a Lifeline. Emotion Could Be it.
description: A Polish historian and journalist says she believes it is time for liberal politicians to lean harder on emotion the way populists have for years.

title: Ban Ki-moon Is Not Leading the U.N. Anymore, but He’s Still Working to Make Change
description: The former secretary general of the United Nations is striving to knock down barriers, foster friendship among nations, and campaign for peace and conflict resolution.

title: Germany Investigates Leaks in Nord Stream Gas Pipelines
description: Neither of the pipelines was active, but both were filled with natural gas. The sharp drop in pressure could only be caused by a leak, authorities said.

title: A New Shot Guards Against H.I.V., but Access for Africans Is Uncertain
description: An injection every two months rather than a daily pill could shield many more women from the virus, but it is unavailable in places that need it most.

title: Markets Calm Down After Recession Fears Drive Steep Drops
description: Concerns about rising interest rates and the prospects of a global slowdown remain.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Europe balks at Italy’s rightward turn.

title: As referendums end, a declaration of Russian annexation is expected to follow.
Cuba Approves Same-Sex Marriage in Historic Vote
description: The sweeping 100-page law will also allow same-sex couples to adopt and includes measures that expand protections for women, children and the elderly.
